bill_title: make an appropriation to fund state university information technology and security system upgrades.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation to fund state university information technology and security system upgrades. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two million eight hundred eight thousand eight hundred sixteen dollars ($ 2,808,816 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents to fund state university information technology and security system upgrades. Section 2. The sums appropriated in section 1 of this Act may be expended as follows: approximately one million two hundred fifty-nine thousand four hundred forty-five dollars ($1,259,445) may be used to upgrade student, faculty, and administrator personal computer systems; approximately seven hundred twelve thousand dollars ($712,000) may be used to enhance instructional delivery systems; and approximately eight hundred thirty-seven thousand three hundred seventy-one dollars ($837,371) may be used to upgrade information technology security systems. Section 3. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2008, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.
